description: Ttwo storey rear extension, internal renovation of existing dwelling, alterations to existing fenestration and associated garden/landscaping works
decision_conditions: The proposed two storey rear extension by reason of its excessive depth, width, size, scale, bulk, massing and detailed design, would fail to harmonise with the architectural composition of the original building and would fail to either preserve or enhance the character or appearance of the surrounding Eastcote Village Conservation Area. The proposal is therefore contrary to Policies BE1 and HE1 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part One - Strategic Policies (November 2012), Policies DMHB 1, DMHB 4, DMHB 11 and DMHD 1 of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part Two - Development Management Policies (January 2020), Policy HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).

The proposed roof lights by reason of their size and appearance both individually and cumulatively, would fail to harmonise with the architectural composition of the original building and would fail to either preserve or enhance the character or appearance of the surrounding Eastcote Village Conservation Area. The proposal is therefore contrary to Policies BE1 and HE1 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part One - Strategic Policies (November 2012), Policies DMHB 1, DMHB 4, DMHB 11 and DMHD 1 of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part Two - Development Management Policies (January 2020), Policy HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).

On this decision notice policies from the Councils Local Plan: Part 1 - Strategic Policies appear first, then relevant Local Plan Part 2 (2020), then London Plan Policies (2021). Hillingdon's Full Council adopted the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part 1 - Strategic Policies on 8 November 2012 and the Hillingdon Local Plan Part 2 on 16 January 2020.
